sen.j: 磐之媛命（いわのひめのみこと、生年不詳-仁徳天皇35年6月（347年）は、古墳時代の皇妃。
sen.e: Iwanohimenomikoto (year of birth unknown – June 347) was a Empress of the Kofun period.
Iwanohimenomikoto (year of birth unknown – June, 347) was an Empress of the Kofun period.
sen.cmt: Juneの後にカンマを追加、a ⇒ anに訂正しました。
sen.e: Iwanohimenomikoto (year of birth unknown – June, 347) was an Empress of the Kofun period.
She was the daughter of KATSURAGI no Sotsuhiko.
She was the daughter of KATSURAGI no Sotsuhiko.
She was the daughter of KATSURAGI no Sotsuhiko.

sen.j: 孝元天皇の男系来孫（古事記では玄孫）。
sen.e: She was the great great great grandchild of the male line of Emperor Kogen.
She was the great great great grandchild (great-great-grandson in Kojiki [The Records of Ancient Matters]) of the male line of Emperor Kogen.
She was the great great great grandchild (great-great-grandson in Kojiki [The Records of Ancient Matters]) of the male line of Emperor Kogen.

sen.j: 仁徳天皇の皇后で、履中天皇・住吉仲皇子・反正天皇・允恭天皇の母。
sen.e: She was the empress of Emperor Nintoku, and the mother of Emperor Richu, Prince Sumiyoshi, Emperor Hanzei, and Emperor Ingyo.
She was the empress of Emperor Nintoku, and the mother of Emperor Richu, Prince Sumiyoshi, Emperor Hanzei, and Emperor Ingyo.
She was the empress of Emperor Nintoku, and the mother of Emperor Richu, Prince Sumiyoshi, Emperor Hanzei, and Emperor Ingyo.

sen.j: とても嫉妬深く、仁徳天皇30年（342年）、彼女が熊野に遊びに出た隙に夫が八田皇女（磐之媛命崩御後、仁徳天皇の皇后）を宮中に入れたことに激怒し、山城の筒城宮（現在の京都府京田辺市）に移り、同地で没した。
sen.e: Iwanohimenomikoto became jealous easily, and in 342, while she was went to go play in Kumano her husband invited Yata no himemiko (Emperor Nintoku's empress after Iwanohimenomikoto died) into the Court, she became very angry and moved to Tsutsukinomiya in Yamashiro (present day Kytotanabe City, Kyoto Prefecture), and died at this spot.

Iwanohimenomikoto became jealous easily, and in 342, when she went to play in Kumano and her husband invited Yata no himemiko (Emperor Nintoku's empress after Iwanohimenomikoto died) into the Court, she became very angry and moved to Tsutsukinomiya in Yamashiro (present day Kytotanabe City, Kyoto Prefecture), and died at this spot.
sen.cmt: while ⇒ whenに訂正しました。she was went to go play ⇒ she went to play に訂正しました。Kumanoの後に and を追加しました。
sen.e: Iwanohimenomikoto became jealous easily, and in 342, when she went to play in Kumano and her husband invited Yata no himemiko (Emperor Nintoku's empress after Iwanohimenomikoto died) into the Court, she became very angry and moved to Tsutsukinomiya in Yamashiro (present day Kytotanabe City, Kyoto Prefecture), and died at this spot.
